title: Duckhorn 2013 Stout Vineyard Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Tart acidity provides freshness and succulence to the palate of this vineyard-designate—a well-resolved expression of plum, cranberry and red currant. Plush and soft, it does the variety justice, making the case for complexity and approachability in one glass.

title: Abacela 2014 Barrel Select Malbec (Umpqua Valley)
description: Impenetrably dark in color, this potent wine marries black fruit to ample barrel accents of smoke and char. Though aged in just 5% new French oak, those dark scents and flavors permeate the wine. It's a style with broad appeal.

title: Adelsheim 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Smooth as silk, this widely-available cuvée brings ripe strawberry, cherry and dark chocolate flavors into play. Aged for 10 months in one quarter new French oak barrels, it's seamlessly melded and shows both power and grace.

title: Aubichon Cellars 2015 Reserve Grenache
description: Light in color, this offers alluring peat, white pepper, herb, earth and raspberry aromas. It dances on the palate, showing elegance and sophistication and bringingplenty of intrigue.

title: Aubichon Cellars 2015 Sur Peaux Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Sur Peaux translates to “on the skins”—a maceration process that gives this wine its burnished copper hue. More importantly, it's crazy good: soft, supple, delicately spicy yet bone dry, with a buttery mouthfeel.

title: Barber 2016 Lumiere Laughing Raven Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Crisp and tart in lemon peel and grapefruit, the loveliest aspect of this lightly ripe wine is its sublime texture, an earthy velvety expression of fineness and elegance that persists in its delicacy.

title: Bergström 2014 Cumberland Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Blended from a range of vineyards, this tasty, toasty wine cloaks its raspberry fruit in chocolate malt-like flavor. Its components are clearly defined, fresh and appealing, and it showcases the sophisticated house style in a more widely-distributed, less expensive offering.

title: Bernardus 2015 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Snappy black raspberry and fresh plum combine for an almost effervescent experience on the nose, which also benefits from smoked beef and carnation aromas. The palate is also very energetic with black-plum and orange-juice flavors, finishing with strong acidity. This will last for years, but needs at least another year to fully integrate.

title: Bernardus 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling's extremely fresh aromas of lime meet with a rounded clarified butter, drawing one in for sip after sip. That vibrancy extends to the lightly presented palate, where flavors of lime juice, lemon peels and crisp pear ride a rising wave of acidity across a tightly wound texture.

title: Marimar Estate 2015 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tightly focused acidity is the star of this well-executed, estate-grown and unoaked white. Floral jasmine and apple blossom ride along the nose, while flavors of lemon peel and apple integrate seamlessly on the rounded palate.

title: Carlisle 2014 Hayne Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is the last vintage from this site from this producer: a sad farewell that doesn't hold back on ripeness or full-figured body. Lush and soft on the palate, it has a strong sense of self, etched in black cherry, chocolate mint and firm tannin. Sock it away and best enjoy beginning in 2024.

title: Cartuxa 2013 Tinto Reserva Red (Alentejo)
description: This powerful wine has big ideas, as indicated by the weight of the bottle. The wine itself is dense, showing some signs of extraction that give a dry and firm aspect to the wine. A juicy, black-plum aftertaste adds lift.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Segredos de São Miguel Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: Ripe and textured, this is a juicy, black-fruit-flavored wine. Power behind the fruit gives firmness and concentration. Acidity and berry fruits contrast with pepper and a bitter edge that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Branco Arinto (Alentejano)
description: Pale gold in color, this was made in clay amphoras, giving a dry wine but one that has a honeyed edge. It is aromatic, ripe, and spicy, with an herbal character as well as good finishing acidity. Drink this limited-production wine from 2018.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Branco

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Aged for three months on its lees in small clay amphoras, this wine has a juicy, fruity character. The red fruits and crisp acidity are impressive and fascinating. Its texture and tannins suggest further aging, so drink from 2018.
designation: Herdade de São Miguel Art.Terra Amphora Tinto

title: Casca Wines 2013 Monte Cascas Vinhas Velhas Old Vines White (Douro)
description: This is a sumptuous wine from Viosinho, a grape winemakers almost gave up on due to low yields. With its lees stirred for 18 months, the wine has intensity and a lightly oxidative character. Now maturing well, its citrus fruit is becoming almost toasty, certainly nutty. Great acidity keeps this rich wine full of crispness. Drink now.
designation: Monte Cascas Vinhas Velhas Old Vines

title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca Reserva Baga (Bairrada)
description: Aged in barrel for 12 months, this is a rich wine. Supple tannins are integrated with the spice, toast and the black-currant fruit that are typical of the Baga grape. It is developing well, with its ripe fruits and crisp acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.

title: Caves Velhas 2013 Cabeça de Toiro Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: This blend of Castelão and Touriga Nacional is well balanced. Spice from wood aging for nine months mingles with the ripe black-currant fruits. A firm wine with rich fruitiness, it's ready to drink.

title: Cent'Anni 2014 Buoni Anni Bianco White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Doug Margerum takes his mastery of making clean and distinctive Burgundian and Rhône wines into Italian whites with this blend of 35% Pinot Bianco, 34% Pinot Grigio and 31% Tocai Friulano from three different vineyards. Lemon peel, lime zest and crisp nectarine show on the nose while the palate's sparkling acidity reveals flavors of white flowers, lemon cream and pear, all wrapped around a steely core.

title: Chalk Hill 2014 Estate Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This is made largely from Cabernet Sauvignon, incorporating Malbec, Petit Verdot, Merlot and Syrah. Thick, rich and lush, it shows dense layers of black currant, blackberry, meat, licorice and cedar. It finishes rounded and dripping in chocolate.

title: Daniel Chotard 2014 Cuvée Marcel Henri  (Sancerre)
description: Old vines are the source of this ripe tropical-fruit-flavored wine. It is concentrated and dense with a flinty texture that is taut and nervy. There is a crisp aftertaste that gives the wine its delicious lift. Drink the wine now.

title: Daniel Chotard 2015  Sancerre
description: Wood aged and ripe, this is a structured wine that is full of fruit and still young. It has bright cherry flavors that have been softened and smoothed out by the wood aging. There is also a mineral edge to the fruitiness. It will be a rich wine but it needs more time. Drink from 2019.

title: Deaver 2015 Primitivo (Amador County)
description: A very dark color and intensely ripe aromas precede flavors of black cherry, blackberry jam and brown sugar in this full-bodied and thickly textured wine. It's impressive for the level of concentration and sense of saturation.

title: Domaine Benoît & Mathieu Fleuriet 2015 Renaissance Les Grandes Marnes  (Sancerre)
description: This rich wine is concentrated and full of fruit. That is balanced by the mineral texture that gives the wine its depth and intensity. With a touch of nutmeg and with fruitiness that is still young, the wine needs to age. Drink from 2018.

title: Saget la Perrière 2015 Domaine de Terres Blanches Bellechaume  (Sancerre)
description: An intense wine, this is all crisp green herbs and tight citrus flavors. With acidity and minerality, it is a complex wine from vineyards in Bué. It could age for another few months and will be better from 2018.

title: Sokol Blosser 2014 Goosepen Block Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Always a top wine in this winery's broad portfolio of estate Pinot Noirs, this is spicy and lightly peppery, with a mix of bitter herb, cranberry and blackberry flavors and bright, supporting acidity. Its pleasing mineral backdrop provides an easy landing for the extended finish. Drink 2022 to 2030 for maximum enjoyment.

title: Villa Huesgen 2015 Enkircher Steffensberg Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Blossomy perfume and candied mango aromas introduce this fleshyripe Auslese. It's forward and fruity yet anchored by zesty acidity and a delicate murmur of tannins. It feels dancingly light in texture yet reverberating on the finish.

title: Quinta da Ribeirinha 2013 Vale de Lobos Touriga Nacional (Tejo)
description: This perfumed and solid wine offers some fine tannins. The black fruits and rich structure give a juicy concentration. Named after the wolves who traditionally lived in the valley where the quinta is situated, this wine is ripe and ready to drink.

title: Quinta da Romaneira 2014 Touriga Nacional-Syrah Red (Duriense)
description: When two naturally perfumed grapes get together they make an intense wine that has big aromas as well as a series of firm tannins and ripe fruit. Blackberry and spice are shot through with acidity to give a solid wine, firmly structured and fruity at the end.

title: Pierre Morin 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: From old vines grown on two different types of chalk soil, this wine is intense and rich. It has ripe apple and pear fruitiness which is balanced by the tangy acidity. The natural concentration from low-yield old vines adds to the density of the wine. Drink from 2018.
